content.question: Which of the following explains a limitation of the three-tiered structure of Wallersteinâ€™s world systems theory?

choices.label: The model does not provide for countries outside of the core to accomplish any of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.
The scale of the model does not pertain to individual countries but rather to regions in the global contexts of core, semiperiphery, and periphery.
Individual countries can score higher on certain indicators of development and lower on other indicators as they shift from the periphery to the core.
The model locks most countries into the development model of core, semiperiphery, and periphery with little opportunity for peripheral economies to advance into the wealthy core.
The three-tiered system of the model cannot be mapped; therefore, the model has no spatial application.

content.answer: The model locks most countries into the development model of core, semiperiphery, and periphery with little opportunity for peripheral economies to advance into the wealthy core.
